column1: A muscle biopsy may be done to identify or detect: - Diseases of the connective tissue and blood vessels (such as polyarteritis nodosa) - Infections that affect the muscles (such as trichinosis or toxoplasmosis) - Muscle disorders such as muscular dystrophy or congenital myopathy - Metabolic defects of the muscle A muscle biopsy may also be done to tell the difference between nerve and muscle disorders.
